channel.title: Posts on Data Pond
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Data Pond

item.title: How does the Bootstrap method work?
item.description: Question of the day? Suppose we have a normal population with a mean of 3 and a standard deviation of 1, how would we illustrate the bootstrap method here? set.seed(1) srs <- rnorm(25, mean=3) resamps <- replicate(1000, sample(srs, 25, TRUE), simplify = FALSE) x_bar_star <- sapply(resamps, mean, simplify =TRUE) Letâ€™s create a histogram here and fit normal curve. hist(x_bar_star, breaks = 40, prob = TRUE) curve(dnorm(x, 3, 0.2), add = TRUE) We can calculate the difference now.

item.title: Testing R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.:19.0 3rd Qu.: 56.00 ## Max. :25.0 Max. :120.00 fit <- lm(dist ~ speed, data = cars) fit ## ## Call: ## lm(formula = dist ~ speed, data = cars) ## ## Coefficients: ## (Intercept) speed ## -17.

item.title: Testing R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.:19.0 3rd Qu.: 56.00 ## Max. :25.0 Max. :120.00 fit <- lm(dist ~ speed, data = cars) fit ## ## Call: ## lm(formula = dist ~ speed, data = cars) ## ## Coefficients: ## (Intercept) speed ## -17.
